MAN.TITLE: unzoom

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : A handle on an axes or a vector of handle on axes.

DESCRIPTION.P: unzoom() is used to remove the zoom effect for all the axes of the current graphic figure:
unzoom(H) is used to remove the zoom effect for all the axes given by the vector of handles on axes H.

MAN.EXAMPLE:
clf() x=0:0.01:6*%pi; plot2d(x,sin(x^2)) zoom_rect([16,-1,18,1]) unzoom()
//subplots accordingly clf() x=0:0.01:6*%pi; subplot(211) plot2d(x,cos(x)) a1=gca(); subplot(212) plot2d(x,cos(2*x)) a2=gca(); rect=[3 -2 7 10]; //a rectangle specified in the current axes (last one) coordinates zoom_rect(rect) unzoom(a1) //unzoom first plot only unzoom(a2) //unzoom second plot only zoom_rect(rect) //zoom again unzoom() //unzoom all the axes
